item.title: 科技股大跌，外资创纪录撤离台积电股票
item.description: 在全球投资者纷纷撤离人工智能领军企业之际，台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. suffered its worst-ever selloff by foreign equity investors last month, amid a global rotation out of the leaders of the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 香港企业转向普通话和小红书求生存
item.description: 香港房地产经纪公司 Habitat Property 过去的主要业务依赖于该市的西方专业人士。如今情况不同了。【原文：Hong Kong real estate broker Habitat Property used to count on the city’s Western professionals for the bulk of its business. Things are different nowadays.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。鸽派的鲍威尔推动股市反弹。日元飙升至三月以来最强。美国考虑单方面限制中国芯片准入。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Dovish Powell fuels equity rally. Yen surges to strongest since March. US considers unilateral restrictions on China’s chip access. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 伊朗下令实施报复性打击的报道令石油价格继续上涨
item.description: 有报道称，伊朗领导人下令对以色列实施报复性打击，因为以色列在其领土上杀害了一名哈马斯领导人。【原文：Oil rose — after surging the most since October on Wednesday — following a report that Iran’s leader ordered a retaliatory strike on Israel for killing a Hamas leader on its soil.】

item.title: 尽管物价降温，澳大利亚提前大选的可能性仍较小
item.description: 在最新的通胀数据几乎排除了再次加息的可能性之后，澳大利亚中左翼政府终于松了一口气，尽管专家们表示，成本压力的消散速度太慢，不适合提前举行大选。【原文：Australia’s center-left government will be breathing a sigh of relief after the latest inflation data all-but ruled out another interest-rate hike, though experts say cost pressures are dissipating too slowly for an early election.】

item.title: 股市因美联储减息希望而反弹，日元走强：市场综述
item.description: 由于美联储不久将降息的迹象增强，亚洲股市周四普遍追随美国股市走高。日本股市则因日元走强而下跌。【原文：Equities in Asia were primed to broadly track US stocks higher Thursday on firming signs the Federal Reserve will soon cut interest rates. Japan was an outlier as stock futures fell to reflect a stronger yen.】

item.title: 医院销售陷入困境，Steward 3,000 万美元的生命线被暂停
item.description: 马萨诸塞州暂停向 Steward Health 提供 3,000 万美元的救命钱，Steward Health 正在关闭两家医院，并警告说，如果不能克服在出售其他六家医疗中心过程中遇到的障碍，可能很快就会被迫转移病人。【原文：Massachusetts paused a $30 million lifeline to Steward Health, which is closing two hospitals and warned it could soon be forced to move patients if it can’t overcome obstacles in its effort to sell six other medical centers.】

item.title: 香港物业代理公司在经济低迷时期利用家族办公室实现增长
item.description: 香港最大的房地产代理公司之一正在扩大其家族办公室服务，在房地产低迷的情况下寻找新的增长点。【原文：One of Hong Kong’s biggest property agencies is expanding its family office services, as it looks for new avenues of growth amid a downturn in real estate.】

item.title: Pilgrim's Pride 利润创历史新高，鸡肉业务势头强劲
item.description: Pilgrim's Pride Corp. 公布的盈利甚至超过了分析师的最高预期，表明鸡肉生产商的反弹势头强于预期。【原文：Pilgrim’s Pride Corp. posted earnings that beat even the highest of analyst estimates, signaling a stronger-than-expected rebound for chicken producers.】

item.title: 加拿大 S&P/TSX 综合指数首次突破 23,000 点
item.description: 加拿大股票基准 S&P/TSX 综合指数（S&P/TSX Composite Index）首次收于 23,000 点以上，原因是投资者转向价值股、商品股和低波动性股票。【原文：Canada’s stocks benchmark, the S&P/TSX Composite Index, has closed above 23,000 points for the first time as investors rotate into value, commodity and low-volatility stocks.】

item.title: 发行量创历史新高后，加拿大市场准备迎接债务大潮
item.description: 加拿大市场即将涌现一些大型债券交易，迄今为止，投资者一直在抢购这些债券。【原文：The Canadian market is about to be flooded with some big bond deals, and investors have so far been snatching up the debt.】

item.title: 美联储将华尔街的降息愿望摆上桌面，股市飙升
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）为央行在 9 月份举行的下一次会议上降低借贷成本敞开大门之后，交易员们对即将到来的降息越来越乐观。【原文：Buy signals flashed across Wall Street Wednesday as traders grew optimistic rate cuts coming soon after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell left the door open to lowering borrowing costs at the central bank’s next meeting in September.】

item.title: 加拿大新管道石油出口从亚洲转向美国
item.description: 加拿大最近扩建的跨山输油管道的原油出口正从亚洲转向美国，这表明该大型项目对全球石油市场的影响仍在不断变化。【原文：Canadian crude exports from the recently expanded Trans Mountain pipeline are shifting to the US from Asia, showing how the major project’s effect on global oil markets remains in flux.】

item.title: 美国潘兴广场削减规模目标后撤回首次公开募股
item.description: 亿万富翁比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）旗下的潘兴广场公司（Pershing Square）撤回了美国封闭式基金的首次公开募股计划，因为一些障碍阻碍了这一备受瞩目的上市计划。【原文：Billionaire Bill Ackman’s Pershing Square has withdrawn an initial public offering for a US closed-end fund after a number of snags held back the highly-anticipated listing.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚一锤定音，将利率下调至 10.75
item.description: 在通胀率飙升削弱了加快货币宽松政策的理由之后，哥伦比亚中央银行作出了一项分裂性决定，将利率下调了半个百分点。【原文：Colombia’s central bank cut interest rates by half a percentage in a split decision after a jump in inflation weakened the case for faster monetary easing.】

item.title: 尽管可能征收关税，中国比亚迪仍寻求进入加拿大电动车市场
item.description: 就在加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）的政府努力抑制从亚洲强国进口汽车之际，中国电动汽车制造商比亚迪股份有限公司（BYD Co.【原文：Chinese electric carmaker BYD Co. is looking to enter the Canadian market just as Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government works to clamp down on imports of vehicles from the Asian powerhouse.】

item.title: 地缘政治局势紧张，国防股迎来两年来最佳月份
item.description: 日益紧张的地缘政治局势和一系列强劲的季度收益使国防股有望创下近两年来的最佳月度涨幅。【原文：Rising geopolitical tensions and a strong set of quarterly earnings have put defense stocks on pace for their best monthly advance in nearly two years.】

item.title: 收购公司包围凯雷 20 亿欧元的 Forgital 项目
item.description: 据知情人士透露，贝恩资本（Bain Capital）和辛文（Cinven）等收购公司正在研究Forgital集团，这是一家主要为航空航天领域生产锻造部件的意大利制造商。【原文：Bain Capital and Cinven are among buyout firms studying Forgital Group, an Italian manufacturer of forged components mainly for the aerospace sector, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美联储利率决议、鲍威尔新闻发布会分析
item.description: 2024年6月12日星期三，美国华盛顿，美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔在联邦公开市场委员会（FOMC）会议后的新闻发布会上。美联储官员预计今年仅有一次降息，并预测2025年将有更多降息，这强化了决策者的呼吁，即在更长时间内保持高借贷成本以抑制通胀。【原文：Jerome Powell, chairman of the US Federal Reserve, during a news conference following a Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, June 12, 2024. Federal Reserve officials penciled in just one interest-rate cut this year and forecast more cuts for 2025, reinforcing policymakers calls to keep borrowing costs high for longer to suppress inflation.】

item.title: 波动性飙升，英伟达千亿美元波动成家常便饭
item.description: 去年大部分时间里，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：The one-way ride Nvidia Corp. took investors on for most of the last year has turned into a whiplashing.】

item.title: 英国能源供应商尽管承担了任务，但仍有 19 亿英镑的赤字
item.description: 据周三发布的一份报告称，英国国内电力供应商没有达到能源危机后为防止破产而规定的财务要求，在支付消费者债务所需的现金储备方面出现了 19 亿英镑（23 亿美元）的缺口。【原文：UK domestic power suppliers aren’t meeting a financial mandate imposed after the energy crisis to guard against bankruptcies, falling £1.9 billion ($2.3 billion) short in the cash reserves needed to cover consumer debt, according to a report released Wednesday.】

item.title: 银行股在情绪 "转折 "中反弹至两年高点
item.description: 在经历了一年的行业不确定性之后，银行股近期一路高歌猛进。【原文：After a year of trudging through industry uncertainty, bank stocks have been on a tear of late.】

item.title: 意大利 Bending Spoons 收购文件共享先驱 WeTransfer
item.description: 意大利移动应用开发商 Bending Spoons SpA 收购了荷兰文件共享服务公司 WeTransfer。【原文：Italian mobile app developer Bending Spoons SpA has acquired WeTransfer, a Dutch file-sharing service that backed out of a public listing two years ago.】

item.title: S&P 将泰晤士水务公司评级最高的债券降至 "垃圾 "级
item.description: S&P 将泰晤士水务金融公司（Thames Water Utilities Finance Plc）的顶级债券降级为垃圾级，并进一步下调了其 B 类证券的评级，警告称该公司的流动性问题在短期内不太可能得到改善。【原文：S&P downgraded Thames Water Utilities Finance Plc’s top-ranked bonds to junk, and lowered its Class B securities further, warning that the firm’s liquidity problems are unlikely to improve in the near term.】

item.title: 欧洲经济反弹受阻，英国金融公司刺激首次公开募股乐观情绪
item.description: 在新股上市势头急剧放缓之后，英国一系列金融服务公司的潜在首次公开募股可能会推动欧洲下一阶段的经济复苏。【原文：Potential initial public offerings by a slew of UK financial services firms could drive the next stage of Europe’s recovery after momentum in new listings slowed sharply.】

item.title: Trafigura 的两位美国顶级石油交易员即将离职
item.description: 美国 Trafigura 集团的两名高级石油交易员即将离职，这是该大宗商品交易巨头在经历前所未有的繁荣之后，在能源交易利润趋于正常化的同时，管理层接班人的最新离职。【原文：Two senior oil traders at Trafigura Group in the US are leaving the firm, the latest departures as the commodity trading giant undergoes a management succession while energy trading profits normalize after an unprecedented boom.】

item.title: 汤姆-布雷迪为以水疗保健为中心的迈阿密办公室支付最高租金
item.description: 在 Netflix 的《汤姆-布雷迪的狂欢》（The Roast of Tom Brady）节目中，这位美国国家橄榄球联盟（NFL）的超级巨星被队友、名人和喜剧演员无情地嘲笑，嘲笑他住在佛罗里达州，嘲笑他严格的饮食习惯和健康养生之道，以及其他各种嘲笑对象。【原文：On Netflix’s The Roast of Tom Brady, the NFL superstar was mercilessly mocked by teammates, celebrities and comedians over living in Florida as well as his strict diet and health regimen, among various other targets for derision.】

item.title: 投资者称可转换债券发行量将比去年增长 67
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp. ）的一项民意调查显示，可转换债券投资者预测未来将出现一波新的发行热潮，他们的预期超过了该银行自己的估计。【原文：Convertible-bond investors predict a wave of new issuance ahead, according to a Bank of America Corp. poll that showed their expectations exceed the bank’s own estimates.】

item.title: 阿诺在威尼斯豪华酒店收购战中出价低于莫哈里
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Mohari Hospitality Ltd 正在就收购威尼斯五星级酒店 Bauer 进行独家谈判，击败了包括亿万富翁 Bernard Arnault 在内的其他竞标者。【原文：Mohari Hospitality Ltd is in exclusive talks to purchase Venice’s five-star Hotel Bauer, according to people familiar with the matter, beating other bidders including billionaire Bernard Arnault.】
